title: Quick Gameplay Thoughts: December 5
body:
Hi folks,
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**Usual Disclaimers**

These posts will often contain talk about future work we're doing, or planning to do, that isn't yet guaranteed to ship. The nature of the work could change or, depending on what we discover, projects mentioned may get delayed or even stopped. If you'd like to see a Tweet whenever a new one of these posts goes up: https://twitter.com/RiotMeddler

http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/6.24.1/img/champion/Ziggs.png
----------------------------------------------------------------------------  
**Snowdown pass and Nexus Blitz**

Both the Snowdown pass and Nexus Blitz will be going live tomorrow morning (6th of December). First, some pass details:

* The Snowdown pass is an updated version of the Worlds pass. You now get tokens from winning games, with half as many for a loss. Champion mastery grades no longer have any effect on tokens earned. You can also get some tokens from first win of the day, from missions and from orbs. 
* Prestige Akali's available this time.
* There will also be some unique rewards that only work on Nexus Blitz/ARAM during this event (special recall VFX/audio, finisher vfx/audio, a fire poro pet). You can unlock those via a second type of token that can only be earned on Nexus Blitz. Can also get them with RP if preferred.
* Pass runs until the 7th of January. More details, numbers especially can be found on Riot Mort's Twitter https://twitter.com/Mortdog/status/1069710221780480005

Plus a quick refresh on what's up with Nexus Blitz:

* We've done a lot of work on Nexus Blitz since its first run, with significantly better map art, improved events and rewards, some changes to the map geo, bans in champion select and more. If you never checked it out previously, or gave it a shot but found it a bit too unpolished, highly recommend giving it a try!
* If Nexus Blitz proves to be really popular throughout its run we'll be looking into making it a permanent mode that's always on. If it gets a decent amount of play, but not enough to break the needed threshold for permanence we'll look at bringing it back as an RGM regularly instead.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------    
**Tower stats and rewards post preseason**

So far tower stats and rewards are performing as we'd hoped. One of our key goals was to address cases where towers fell too quickly, cutting lane phase off too early. We didn't want to increase the length of longest laning phases by contrast, feeling those were already long enough. Looking at some stats:. 

10th percentile (towers fall before this time only 10% of the time)

* 8.22 = 9 minutes, 11 seconds
* 8.23 = 11 minutes, 8 seconds

50th percentile (towers fall before this time 50% of the time)

* 8.22 = 12 minutes, 17 seconds
* 8.23 = 14 minutes, 1 second

90th percentile (towers fall before this time 90% of the time)

* 8.22 = 15 minutes, 35 seconds
* 8.23 = 15 minutes, 56 seconds

These are stats from all MMR ranges combined. When looking at high MMR only all of the above values are about 1 minute faster, both in 8.22 and 8.23.

Other goals were to make diving a bit more risky, via increased tower damage. We're still seeing a decent amount of diving going on, but with somewhat increased odds of a turnaround being possible, so that's also looking good so far. Still looking into data on the rewards side of things, will have that to share soonish. Also looks pretty appropriate though, with income up a bit but not dramatically, leading to champs more often leaving laning phase with their first big item completed as desired. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------       
**Lane Swaps**

Lane Swaps are on our minds a bit given the changes to towers and game pacing. We don't want to see the game end up back in a state where early lanes are uncontested and champions just don't interact in organized play. We are open to  early rotations or 1v2s as an occasional thing, though have some caution about how balance-able lane swapping as a more niche but viable option is, given it's been extremely frequent or missing entirely historically. Not concerned at present, given there are a lot of factors that should stop lane swaps being excessively powerful, or could be tuned to do so if needed. Plating gives more time to respond to towers going down. Plating rewards make it more costly to not defend your own towers. First tower gold, though smaller now, still exists as does tower fortification (50% reduced damage on top and mid outer towers in the first 5 minutes). 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------     
**Katarina changes on the PBE** 

We've got a couple of changes to Kat's E hitting PBE I wanted to mention since they hard to spot or datamine and feedback on them would be useful:

* Spell Buffering - Gunblade Active can now be buffered with all of Kat's spells. Should be particularly noticeable for higher ping players.
* E - Cast time is now split into 0.075s before the blink and 0.075s after it, instead of 0.15s all up front. Should make E feel better when dodging incoming spells or picking up daggers.

Hello Meddler,

there has been for some time alot of complains (forum, reddit etc.) about the general damage in the game beeing too high. Something I've started to agree with; the game often times feels like "Who bursts whom faster wins".

Has there been any talk about this in the team? Do you like it the way it is or do you have any plans to decrease damage in the game?

I don't think he's going to answer. There have been countless threads here, on the Boards, alone for nearly the entire season. They never bothered to answer.

Hell, he answered the guy asking about Smash Ultimate, who also posted about an hour ago, but not you. Think about it.
I mean, then we just need to ask again next time in order to make clear it's a problem that atleast a good portion of the playerbase thinks need to be addressed.
We've been asking nearly the entire season, as I mentioned. What's different in whether we ask here, specifically?
What is the alternative you propose? I generally still like the game, so I'd rather keep asking hoping to maybe get an answer at some point/prompt them to think about the topic.

The alternative is action as in not buying anything for a while. That's gonna hurt them and make them finally respond. But we need a very large % of the playerbase to do it and I don't think that's ever gonna happen. Besides, your original comment has nearly equal up- and downvotes, meaning the playerbase hasn't even gotten to a consensus on this topic.

You guys act as if this is a question that hasn’t been answered. The League balance team, along with Meddler specifically, has mentioned on numerous times that they believe the games overall damage is too high and have been taking steps to address it. Some more or less successfully (i.e. Dark Harvest rework, Infinity Edge rework, Celerity rework, talks of Absolute Focus being too strong, etc) but regardless of success the team is taking steps to try and reduce the game’s overall damage output. In that same vein though, if you’re all inning a Zed as Syndra, it’s absoluteg going to be a who bursts who faster. In reality it’s going to be like versus any assassin or _burst_ mage.

On a personal note, Meddler doesn’t have to respond to you. He started doing these posts as a courtesy, not an obligation. Don’t expect him to go out of his way like you are entitled to his time.

TL;DR:
Meddler isn’t your personal buddy in Riot Games, nor is he obligated to respond or even acknowledge you. The questions you’re asking are already being addressed or in discussion, but systematic changes like “the whole game’s damage is too high” is a lot more difficult to address than nerfing Irelia. Rather than whining about how Meddler doesn’t respond to your posts, instead research what change the Riot team is already doing to address your concerns and offer your _constructive feedback_ to improving them knowing that Meddler will probably read but not respond to your posts.

Having such amazing designers, like Meddler, who share their internal workings with the community is a privilege, not a right.

been a  lot of discussion, and complaints about damage being to high, and i would agree. I enjoy playing tanks, but it feels like only tank supports (and some tank junglers) are good right now. This could just be because damage is to high currently.
Is there any talk about damage being to high, or how tanks have been preforming (mostly in top lane im wondering about)?

I'm gonna piggyback off your relatively high position in the discussion to go ahead and leave links to the myriad posts there currently are right now for damage being too high.

[Rush Cloth Armor, +10 armor runes, lvl 4 Zed poke combos me for 60% of my HP](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/kB2J1o3E-rush-cloth-armor-10-armor-runes-lvl-4-zed-poke-combos-me-for-60-of-my-hp)

I really would like a Riot answer on this one, since last "Quick Gameplay Thoughts" talked about ADCs being too weak when they polled people, but the seemingly overwhelming opinion on the boards is that damage, including from ADCs, is too high.  Like, I get that the boards can be loud and full of very angry people who all want their opinions made into the game, but it seems really odd to me that there is such a wide gap between the clear feelings of all the dedicated players on the NA boards, and the people Riot Games polled.  I really would just like some clear explanation on how that wide of a margin is possible.

Several months ago, you did a pass on "Upfront damage" by nerfing several Runes that gave said free damage, Scorch, Electrocute, Aery, etc. Several months later, are you guys satisfied with those changes from long ago, and if not, do you have any plans moving into the future?

I just don't understand who thought this new lazy way of doing events was a good idea; the whole concept of missions was made and then barely used, only now to feel like it's just being pushed aside for a lazy, grindy event pass. Events are supposed to be fun/enjoyable and yet they've become a hard grind for rewards, not having fun playing the game and getting rewarded for it. Not to mention too, with three Prestige skins with the new Aatrox now, how long will this sales tactic work anyways? People won't put in effort or money into something they don't feel is worth the value and the rarity of a skin increases that value drastically; pumping out 3 prestige skins after making such a big deal about how special prestige Kai'sai was _supposed_ to be is just gonna burn out the whole concept.

Thats why you just gotta... not buy the passes, stop giving riot money for doing stupid things and incentivizing them to keep doing it. 

Chromas were supposed to be just ways to play a skin that wasn't ... the same skin all the time, and replaced 520 RP skins. 
but now every champion and skin that comes out has 7 chromas and they add at least 1 exclusive chroma per patch and a handful of random skins get chromas because.... ? 
Obviously they print money. 

Don't get me wrong - I want Riot to continue succeeding and am pretty much whale status myself. No company should be taught success comes from scum tactics like hyping something up as unique and then repeating it OVER AND OVER AND OVER AND OVER, not to mention theyre just making prestige skins because a certain champ is woefully Overpowered in competitive, which theyre mistaking as the player base actually liking the champion. 
See Kai'sa, who no one cared that much about but Riot made two skins for her less than a year after release because her play rate was so high. 
Well yeah, not picking Kai'sa in high elo was inting. Of course shes going to be in every game.

Hello Meddler,  

How is Sona doing currently in this meta? I would love to hear anything about the current state of Sona's W and how weak it feels compared to every other enchanter's main protective abilitiy (Janna's E scales with 70% ap and has way higher base stats, so does Nami's W, Soraka's W and Lulu's E).  

It scales really bad and the base heal/shield stats aren't strong either (30 heal/25 shield at level 1), plus, the mana costs on W are insane early game, especially if you're against a mage support botlane (most of supports are mage nowadays and they hit like a truck) and you need the extra sustain, I would love to see her W get some of its nerfs reverted or even a slight buff to the base stats or ap scaling of it, thank you.
I would LOVE to see Sona's W get its mana cost decreased, why does it cost 80 mana at level one while healing so badly?

her winrate is like 54%.


not unusual for a champ like sona but def not indicative of someone who needs buffs
Only because all of her counters are in a really terrible state (Lulu, Karma, Rakan, Braum) and the rest of enchanter supports being really weak at the moment.

Let's say that's true.

That's still a champion that should not be buffed

The Galio changes completely remove his identity as a warden/protector and push him towards an AP bruiser kind of play style. These changes also make his ult feel completely pointless and it is on such a long cool down while the ability isn't eve very good. Some basic abilities have more impact than Galio ult with these new changes. I loved playing as Galio but now he feels completely garbage only because of pro play.

This might go without saying, but will there be followup for galio in the current pbe patch? Afaik the changes were meant to be an overall buff for galio. Also now that his ult doesn't absolutely prevent allies from dying could it have it's early cd reduced slightly?

Crucially if the changes with galio are successful do you see a similar approach being taken with shen as regards to his ult?

Need to see where Galio lands, follow up in 8.24b is certainly possible. Goal was to shift power around in a way that buffed him for regular play without adding power (or at least much power) for organized/pro. If he ends up weaker in regular play would want to add some power in, would be really hesitant to do ult CD though, given that spell offers more value in organized play.

Taking power out of Shen ult and moving it elsewhere is possible. We do see regular games get a lot more value out of the shield on Shen ult than the DR on Galio though, given Shen ult can be used more reactively and less proactively so doesn't reward practice and coordination as a team as heavily. Not sure reducing defensive value from it would necessarily be the way to go as a result.

Hi Meddler! Could you go into detail about what niche you want Spear of Shojin to have? Since you said the problem is it's not distinct enough currently.

Right now a big reason bruisers get a bad rap is their build path - unless they're playing pure assassin, they get two damage items into tank. At the three item mark, the adc suddenly faces a 200-250 AD Vi who ALSO has a Randuins. Spear is super important because light fighters need a full buildpath of hybrid items - not only does it help them scale throughout the entire game, but more importantly, it also keeps them relatively squishy unless they opt into pure defensive items. Making bruisers a healthy, balanceable class requires making them useful and vulnerable at all stages of the game. 

Thanks!
